wikipedia_page.main: John Trotter (died 1856) was a British Conservative politician.He was elected Conservative MP for West Surrey at a by-election in 1840—caused by the succession of George Perceval to the peerage—and held the seat until 1847 when he did not seek re-election.He died 31 August 1856, aged 77 at the family home, Horton Manor, Epsom.
